title: Can we buy a new 4G smartphone to wait for 5G in India? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hey Don’t Wait For 5G! Read untill end you will Understand. The Most Cheapest Smartphone Was Launched Rs 4999  Amazon India has added another budget smartphone under the 10.or brand (Tenor is how this is pronounced). It is a part of ‘Crafted for Amazon’ program, an offering to guarantee support to select brands for their products throughout its life. The 10.or D is the third smartphone from the company, which had earlier released 10.or G and 10.or E. The 10.or D though, is a budget smartphone with a starting price tag of Rs 4,999 for the 2GB RAM and 16GB storage version. The 3GB RAM and 32GB storage version of 10.or D is priced at Rs 5,999. The under Rs 5000 pricing meaning it will compete with devices like Xiaomi’s Redmi 5A in the market. In terms of specifications, 10.or D has a 5.2-inch HD resolution display (720 x 1080 pixels) and is powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 425 processor and 13MP rear camera and a 5MP front camera. 10.or D’s processor is clocked at 1.4GHz and this is a quad-core one coupled with Adreno 308 GPU. Battery is the other aspect of this phone that Amazon is highlighting as it comes with a 3500mAh one on board. It runs on Android 7.1.2 Nougat out-of-the-box. The smartphone has near stock Android powering it, though Amazon apps will be pre-loaded. There’s also a fingerprint sensor on board. Interestingly, Amazon is promising two days of battery life with the 10.or D smartphone, which at this price point could be a crucial feature. The 10.or D mobile also comes with OTG support and there’s FM Radio on board as well. The 10.or D mobile will go on sale on January 5, 2018. Users will have to register on Amazon India to get alerts about the sale, though the company does not call this a flash sale. Amazon is also giving Amazon Prime members who purchase this smartphone an year of additional warranty on the device. India recently launched GSAT-10 specifically for 5G an another sat is going to be launched.
